rev.comment: /* Historical analysis */ Claimed connections to 20th cent. totalitarianism, cites
Fascism's ties to French Revolution. Source quoted to avoid (erroneous) claim of misrepresentation.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 301416487 by [[Special:Contributions/Mamalujo|Mamalujo]] Article did not support assertion. Therefore the assertion was not sourced, and removal was fully justified.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 301414550 by [[Special:Contributions/The Four Deuces|The Four Deuces]] ([[User talk:The Four Deuces|talk]]) - Unjustified removal of sourced material.
Remove fringe theory presented as academic consensus
/* Historical analysis */ most scholars see Terror as tied to fascism, cite
[[WP:RBK|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Azza12321|Azza12321]] ([[User talk:Azza12321|talk]]) to last version by Durova
Reverted to revision 296671917 by [[Special:Contributions/Chatfecter|Chatfecter]]; rv: claimed source was not used to build the article. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
Repairing link to disambiguation page - [[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]]
Added the references from the main article
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Legislative Assembly (1791–1792) */ higher levels does not make sense
see also already included in history of france and french rev templates
see alsos already included in main body of text or french revolution template
/* External links */ condense, no need to put French revolution as this is title of article
move an image to top. also, not obvious and no explanation as to why hide in print template used
every other + singular/ restore Louis XVIII→restore monarchy, as one cannot *restore* a king who has not reigned yet/
/* Estates-General of 1789 */ edit has to had
/* Intrigues and radicalism */ nearly entire article is unreffed
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
This should be changed to an inline citation.
Robot - Speedily moving category 18th century revolutions to 18th-century revolutions per [[WP:CFD|CFD]].
Robot - Speedily moving category 18th century rebellions to 18th-century rebellions per [[WP:CFD|CFD]].
moved [[HẬ6 6 E R?]] to [[French Revolution]] over redirect: rvv
/* Reign of Terror */ move around, only most general stuff in lead, also for chronological reasons (Carrier came after the Vendee, not before it)
/* Reign of Terror */ distinguishing Chouans and Vendeans
/* Reign of Terror */ Vendée: more accurate figures; qualification of Westermann's statement; better sources than the New York Times.
that said, the point of avoiding weasel words is to give sources; they are given here. Here, I see no reason to stress the scholars' names. If you see one, feel free to rv to the previous version.
/* Historical analysis */ you do see the names in the refs, why not just add them if you think it necessary?
Date maintenance tags and general fixes

/* Reign of Terror */ There was no official principle equating *any* dissent with counter-rev.; they were tried on various specific false charges (conspiracies etc.), not on charges of dissent per se.
/* Historical analysis */ this is plain nonsense, the Bolsheviks were openly comparing their situation with 1789 at least as often, including using the concept of "Thermidor" ad nauseam.
/* Historical analysis */ re-add stuff deleted for an invalid reason in September; requesting source for it and for the other interpretations
/* Reign of Terror */ detail about 1793 constitution
/* End of the Terror */ The connection between the adoption of the 1795 constitution and the end of terror is not *that* direct.

I see the first item underwent development from "democracy" through "republic" to "nationalism". All three are true, but none is, strictly speaking,an "Enlightenment principle" (least of all the last)
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 265167429 by [[Special:Contributions/Poetaris|Poetaris]] ([[User talk:Poetaris|talk]]) reliable sources only please
/* Economy */ link repair ([[Wikipedia:WikiProject Red Link Recovery|You can help!]])
/* Storming of the Bastille */ Sounded like the Monarchy found the Bastille to be tyrannical!
remvd *circa* before 1789. The opening of the Estates-General on 5 May began the Revolution which exploded on 14 July with the Storming of the Bastille. Before 1789 were causes/events leading to it.
/* External links */ EB1911 article in Wikisource
/* Summary of Causes */ caps. in "Little Ice Age" to be consistent with the linked article
Bot: [[als:Französische Revolution]] is a featured article
/* Execution of Louis XVI */ fix sentence
Updating page numbers after [[Template_talk:Cite_book#Ready_to_go|recent improvement]] to [[Template:Cite book]]. Added: nopp.
Constitutional Monarchy, ok. Two Empires, ok. Republics, ok. But dictatorship??? When?

robot Adding: [[pms:Rivolussion fransèisa]], [[zh-min-nan:Hoat-kok Kek-bēng]] Modifying: [[mt:Ir-Rivoluzzjoni Franċiża]]
not vand. but changes are not warranted
/* See also */ Changed some punctutation to "Tale of Two Cities" and "Scarlet Pimpernal"
/* Summary of Causes */ Removed a disgusting piece of spam.
